result.execSummary:
The defendant Lewis O Houston was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program AFTER serving 2 years initial confinement in this case.
Consecutive to: any other sentence. Credit for 127 days time served.
Same conditions as probation except for condition time.
Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

miscConds.notes:
*Restitution is ordered in the amount of $825.00 to be paid to Jacolby H.  Joint and several with Darriana Briggs 15CF1018.
*Restitution hearing scheduled on 09/03/15 in Branch 26.

*Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
*Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.

*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.

*Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
*Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Jacolby H., Latasia J. and Co-actor Darriana Briggs.

*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.

timeConds.notes:
*Forthwith.
*The first 5 months straight time.  
*The last 5 months, Huber privileges for work, school, treatment.  The defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, defendant Lewis O Houston not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for restitution hearing.  The State has informed the Court the victim no longer wishes to pursue restitution.  No objection from defense.  Court ordered no additional restitution.

Defendant Lewis O Houston in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Lewis O Houston in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned for restitution hearing in Branch 26.

State complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 6 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 3 years with credit for 127 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 years.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years. 

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*As a condition of probation, the Court ordered defendant to serve 10 months in the House of Correction.  FORTHWITH.  
 - The first 5 months straight time.  
 - The last 5 months, huber privileges for work, school, treatment.  The defendant is eligible for the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Jacolby H., Latasia J. and Co-actor Darriana Briggs.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Restitution is ordered in the amount of $825.00 to be paid to Jacolby H.  Joint and several with Darriana Briggs 15CF1018.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

- Pay all costs, surcharges and restitution, including the mandatory DNA surcharge by the end of probation. If revoked, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 2 years initial confinement in this case.

Appeal rights given.    
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Lewis O Houston in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Lewis O Houston in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.   Restitution will be determined at sentencing.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lewis O Houston in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for Projected guilty plea and sentencing.   Defense counsel requests new date.   Case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 26.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION (HOC) FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 26.

Attorney Jeff T. Wilson in court, Defendant Lewis O Houston not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for Tyrone Martin St. Junior for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from the House of Correction (HOC) for purposes of this hearing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lewis O Houston in court with attorney Jeff T. Wilson.  Defendant Lewis O Houston in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with L.J., J.H., and Darianna B.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lewis O Houston in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Lewis O Houston in custody.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the defendant.  Court advised Defendant that he may qualify to have the DNA sample date expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
